title: Beautiful 3 Bedroom in East Falls
description:
Character abound in this charming, 3 story townhome featuring nearly 1,700 square feet located on a quiet, tree-lined street in the heart of East Falls.
This house has all of the character without sacrificing convenience including original hardwood floors, exposed brick, custom crown molding, French-Café Style Plantation Shutters, central air, washer/dryer on site along with a beautiful, updated kitchen with granite counterstops, stainless steel appliances, and under cabinet lighting. 2nd floor of the home includes a full updated bath and 2 sizeable bedrooms. 3rd Floor includes over 500 square feet for the main bedroom with plenty of closet space and a separate space for a second sitting area or office. Walkable eateries include Fiorino, LeBus, En Riva, the Black Squirrel, ThunderMug, Vault & Vine, Boutique River Falls, Foghorn, Wissahickon Brewery and more. Not to mention, you are steps from Kelly Drive & Wissahickon Trail. Enjoy all East Falls has to offer. Feel like going downtown? You're a 5 minute walk to the East Falls train station- accessible to Center City Philly in less than 15 minutes. Available to rent beginning December 1st. For those interested, please call or text  show contact info

1st month, last month, and security will be due at signing.

title: Location is key and quality is condition. This colonial rowhome stands
description: Location is key and quality is condition. This colonial rowhome stands pretty in the desirable neighborhood of the International City/Eastwick community. This beautiful property, quietly sits, and offers much peace of mind. Well-maintained by previous and current owner, in less than 6 years, they have installed newer roofing, HVAC, a hot water heater, 5 newer windows and window fitted shutters. Not to mention, the transferable solar panel contract offers major savings on the utility bill. This home has forgone some slight changes this year, including a reconfigured lower level bathroom- to now include a stall shower. Also, the garage has been properly converted to two separate rooms. Both originally designed as bedrooms (one with private entrance) but, can they easily be used as a home office or separate play area. Hardwood floors run throughout the sizable living and dining room area. This leads us to an eat in kitchen and, an alluring central staircase.

title: Very Spacious 2 bedroom 1 bathroom perfect home.
description: Welcome to Bridgeview! Located in bustling Old City, on a quiet cobblestone street, is a renovated, top floor loft for you to call home. The building features high quality amenities including roof deck, garage parking, 24 hour concierge service, and a thriving association of owners. Your new home, unit 616, is bathed in natural light and features the high ceilings and exposed brick walls of your dreams. Enter the unit and find ample storage by the door before moving toward the kitchen, notice the hardwood floors throughout. You’ll first find an updated kitchen with a fresh new backsplash, stainless steel appliances and tons of storage. From here, you’ll enter the open living space with plenty of room for a dining table and living room set. Notice the size of these windows! You’ll find more closet storage on the way to the full bath that features stone tile and radiant heating in the floors. Next, is the large primary bedroom with two huge windows and more exposed brick. Another closet here for additional storage. Lastly you’ll find the bonus room that is perfect for a nursery, home office, gym, dressing room, yoga room, guest bedroom or whatever you desire to make of it! Unit 616 comes with deeded garage parking (near the elevator) and a 3x6 storage unit on the 6th floor (near the elevator and unit). Easy access to the Market Frankford Line, I-95 and the Ben Franklin Bridge make this a commuter's dream and on the evenings and weekends you are in the heart of everything that Old City has to offer including tons of boutiques, coffee shops, restaurants and museums. Don’t miss your opportunity to claim this stylish home for yourself!

title: Very Spacious 2 bedroom 3 bathroom perfect home.
description: Spacious & Sunny rarely offered end residence with upper garage parking. This 1,500 + SQFT home is an architect-designed move-in ready, tri-level, 2-bedroom, 2.5-bathroom residence at River’s Edge Condominium. The entry-level consists of an extra-large storage closet, laundry room, and powder room. The main living level has an open kitchen, living & dining area that highlights your balcony with entry from both the living and dining spaces offering gorgeous river views, the Cira Center, and lush treetops.  Huge, updated kitchen with plenty of cabinets and counter space, an island, and a window over the kitchen sink. Finally, retreat to the upper level to enjoy two serene bedrooms & ensuite baths: a Center hall linen closet and another extra-large storage closet.  4 zones of HVAC,  Basic cable & wifi $62.90/m, electric extra, assessment $210.25/M ends 12/21/2023 If you work in the city, commute, or want to take advantage of all the city offers, this home is ideal. It is a short walk to Center City, Market Street business district, Suburban Station, Amtrak’s 30th Street Station, University City (University of Pennsylvania and Drexel University), and the Art Museum. Shop at the brand-new Giant and Starbuck right next door. Not to mention that Whole Foods and Trader Joe's are a few blocks away.  Step outside, and you are a few steps away from the Schuylkill River Trail! Drive out of your above-ground parking spot and get onto all major highways within minutes, including 76, 676, and 95. Rivers Edge is a boutique condominium building with 24-HOUR DOORMAN, a newly renovated lobby, use of an EXPANSIVE ROOF DECK with more endless views…especially during fireworks! PET-FRIENDLY.”

title: Classic (EXPANDED & RENOVATED) Philly Trinity! * Great LOCATION!!
description:
Here's a great, uniquely-Philly house in a great neighborhood!
The house is a classic "trinity" house probably constructed in the late 1700s/early 1800s.
Note, though, that the house has been EXPANDED over the years. Original Trinities had one room on each floor. This house has TWO rooms on each floor + a deck off the 2nd floor bedroom.
"Philadelphia "Trinity" Houses: Built 1703-1836 to house tradesmen and artisans, these small brick structures were built in the Georgian and Federal-style along a cobblestone street. The name trinity refers to the three-story vertical structure connected by a spiral staircase."
Sears Street @ S 3rd Street (very close to E Moyamensing Ave)
Pennsport / South Philly / Queen Village Adjacent, Philadelphia
This classic Philadelphia "trinity" house was COMPLETELY RENOVATED. Finishes are high-end and upscale. Important foundational components have been addressed too; there's a recently-installed roof, deck and paved backyard patio. Location? It's excellent! You're really close & equidistant from South Street and the Italian Market. So if you like biking or walking, this house is an excellent fit. Otherwise, there's lots of on-street parking immediately accessible.
Monthly Rent: $1695 for leases starting on or November 16
Utilities: Gas, Electric & Water on your own meters.
Lease: 1 year lease required w/detailed agreement.
Move-in: 1st month, last month + security.
Pets: Cat OK (and maybe a small dog) with pet addendum & fee.
Exterior Front: Steel front door with privatized leaded-glass detail. All front windows have been "capped" to reduce drafts. New house number, front light and railing.
Living Room: Enter directly into the compact living room featuring newly installed recessed lighting. There's a built-in closet directly ahead for storage. You can't miss the beautiful Caribbean Pine flooring. It starts at the front door and continues. . .
Kitchen: . . .into the kitchen. The entire first floor has hardwood flooring. On the way into the kitchen, you'll see the entrance to the basement (and stairs to the 2nd floor) to your left. A modern Italian-tiled "feature" wall wraps around the right-side entrance to the kitchen and faces the kitchen door. The kitchen cabinets are bright white w/stainless trimming and handles. Mini-subway tiles and black glass serve as the backsplash above a black granite countertop. Modern appliances including a compact dishwasher and gas stove.
Patio/Backyard: The backyard was dug out to uncover a ground drain, then completely resurfaced. The back wall has been painted. A new wooden fence was installed on the west side of the patio, including a gate leading to a side walkway to the front street (great for taking out trash and storing your bike).
Bathroom (2nd floor): Original circular wood stairs lead up to 2nd floor hall w/original hardwood plank flooring. Full bathroom at the front of the house with upgraded fixtures. . . even the bathtub. The bathtub "surround" is completely tiled with white marble. More modern Italian porcelain tile on the floor. Full-glass medicine cabinet and modern vanity. Chrome bath hardware.
Bedroom (2nd floor): Our contractor installed unique random-width plank flooring including all American hardwoods -- white oak, red oak, hickory and cherry. There's a built-in closet for clothing. A sliding fabric-panel system opens to reveal a large deck exclusively accessible from this bedroom.
Third floor: Climb another set of circular steps to the top floor, where you'll find a second bedroom w/new exotic-wood laminate flooring. The ceiling is super high, with painted beam struts and modern glass and stainless fixtures. There's another small room on the third floor, too -- great as a computer room, home office, extra large walk-in closet, etc.
Basement: Unfinished with your own washer & dryer + storage space!
Location, location, location:
Location is excellent. You're really close/equidistant to Queen Village and the Italian Market. Just a few blocks south of Washington Avenue, right off one of Queen Village's main North/South thoroughfares, E Moyamensing Avenue.
Great spot for biking and walking!
Herman's Coffee is 1/2 block away. Jaxx Steaks & Taproom, Pennsport Beer Boutique and Aroma on 3rd are around the corner.
